comments: Sabonis (IND) firms up in his screening position in White's (CHI) path following the hand-off and absorbs the contact, some of which occurs to White's leg.
Temple (CHI) swipes down and cleanly dislodges Brogdon (IND) of the ball after his gather.

Temple (CHI) and Brogdon (IND) make incidental arm contact with one another as they each attempt to gain control of the loose ball. Young (CHI) then swipes forward and makes clean contact with the ball before any incidental contact occurs with Brogdon.
Turner (IND) establishes verticality and absorbs the contact made with LaVine (CHI) during the driving shot attempt.
Sabonis (IND) brings his off-arm toward Young's (CHI) right arm and marginal contact occurs as Young contests the layup attempt.
Young (CHI) maintains a legal guarding position as he contests Sabonis' (IND) layup attempt.
Young (CHI) establishes himself in a screening position in Holiday's (IND) path and absorbs the contact.
Turner (IND) makes contact with the ball and the part of LaVine's (CHI) hand that is on the ball, cleanly dislodging it from LaVine after his gather. Any contact thereafter is deemed incidental.
White (CHI) makes clean contact with the ball and as his arm slides forward, marginal contact occurs with Holiday's (IND) arm.
Valentine (CHI) extends his hand as he attempts to retrieve the rebound and some contact occurs with Brogdon's (IND) left hand/arm, but Brogdon is able to control the rebound.
Temple (CHI) establishes himself in a screening position in Holiday's (IND) path and absorbs the contact. Temple and Holiday engage and disengage thereafter.
Sabonis (IND) legally contests LaVine's (CHI) jump shot attempt.

Young (CHI) is bracing for the contact and absorbs it when it occurs with Sabonis (IND) during his upward shooting motion. Young's forearm extends slightly thereafter and marginal contact occurs with Sabonis' front.
Temple (CHI) and Brogdon (IND) engage and disengage with one another during rebounding.

Sabonis (IND) extends his arm forward during rebounding and some contact occurs with the side of Young's (CHI) head after Sabonis makes contact with the ball. Contact to an opponent?s head/face can be deemed marginal when the result of a natural basketball move, provided the contact is not disproportionate or uncontrolled.
White (CHI) establishes himself in a screening position in Holiday's (IND) path and absorbs the contact as the defensive switch takes place.
Brogdon (IND) commits a take foul on Young (CHI).
Sumner (IND) commits a take foul on LaVine (CHI).
Brogdon (IND) goes to, not through, Young's (CHI) space when contact occurs during the drive and he does not dislodge him from his defensive position.
Temple (CHI) makes clean contact with the ball and dislodges it as Brogdon (IND) starts his upward shooting motion.

Brogdon (IND) slightly extends his left arm outward after the ball is dislodged and some contact occurs with Temple's (CHI) head/neck area as he retrieves it. Contact to an opponent?s head/face can be deemed marginal when the result of a natural basketball move, provided the contact is not disproportionate or uncontrolled.
Temple (CHI) maintains a legal guarding position as he contests Brogdon's (IND) shot attempt.
Valentine (CHI) and Sabonis (IND) engage and disengage with one another during the inbound.
Valentine's (CHI) right arm is slightly extended outward when contact occurs with Holiday (IND), and Valentine absorbs the contact before quickly bringing his arm back to his side.
Brogdon (IND) maintains a rested hand on LaVine's (CHI) left arm and marginal contact occurs during LaVine's drive.
LaVine (CHI) has his left hand rested on Brogdon's (IND) front and marginal contact occurs as LaVine naturally releases away.
Brogdon (IND) and Sabonis (IND) legally contest LaVine's (CHI) jump shot attempt.
